message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.CY, cs.GT, cs.LG

The paper deals with the security and decentralization aspects of cryptocurrencies, which are typically studied in the computer security (cs.CR) and distributed computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. The empirical analysis of stake shift in major cryptocurrencies involves statistical and computational methods, which are relevant to the computer science and game theory (cs.GT) sub-category. The study also involves analyzing the behavior of real-world actors, such as exchanges, which falls under the cybernetics (cs.CY) sub-category. Finally, the paper quantifies the sublinear growth of stake shift with the length of the considered lag interval, which is a topic of interest in the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
